entry.title: Survey of the stable marriage problem

link.title: Survey of the stable marriage problem

entry.content:
A survey of the stable marriage problem flow:

  • Describe the problem with an interesting example (Pride and Prejudice?). Follow Gale Shapely, see Riehl’s take.
  • Optimality of the marriages and the order structure(Knuth book page number).
  • Distributive lattice structure of preference list (Knuth, Blair) and P-complete nature of enumeration .
  • Roth’s discussion of incentive for the proposed to lie about preferences while the proposers have no incentive misrepresentation and optimality.
  • College admissions is subtly different from stable marriage.
  • Stochastic nature: Average number of stable matchings :Shows proposers get \(\log n\) ranked preference while the proposed gets \(\dfrac{n}{\log n}\) ranked preference. Vazirani robustness.
  • Discuss Knuth math for efficiency. Finally motivate efficiency in competitive markets with unbalanced sidesAdding an extra man reverses the preference list.
